com.company.vesper.lib

Class HttpConnectionLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.vesper.lib.HttpConnectionLibrary

  • public class HttpConnectionLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
    Custom Library for HTTP Restful Connections. Simplifies using Volley

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(android.content.Context context)

      • sendGET

        public static void sendGET(java.lang.String requestURL,
                           HttpConnectionLibrary.getStringListener callback)
        Sends a GET request using Volley. Response type is a String
        Parameters:
        requestURL - Target URL of the GET request
        callback - callback function when response is returned. Best used in lambda format "(response: String) -> {}"

      • sendGET

        public static void sendGET(java.lang.String requestURL,
                           org.json.JSONObject jsonRequest,
                           HttpConnectionLibrary.getJsonListener callback)
        Sends a GET request using Volley. Response type is a JSONObject
        Parameters:
        requestURL - Target URL of the GET request
        callback - callback function when response is returned. Best used in lambda format "(response: JSONObject) -> {}"

      • sendPOST

        public static void sendPOST(java.lang.String requestURL,
                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
        Send a POST request using Volley. Use when don't need to listen to POST response.
        Parameters:
        requestURL - Target URL of the POST request
        params - HashMap of the params to be encoded in the POST body

      • sendPOST

        public static void sendPOST(java.lang.String requestURL,
                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params,
                            HttpConnectionLibrary.postListener callback)
        Send a POST request using Volley. Use when need to subscribe to POST response.
        Parameters:
        requestURL - Target URL of the POST request
        params - HashMap of the params to be encoded in the POST body
        callback - callback function when response is returned. Best used in lambda format "(response: String) -> {}"
